items.content_html:
Summary

Chrome 123/124 includes features required for developers to create cross-document View Transitions. This includes:

  • The PageRevealEvent interface
  • The pagereveal event
  • The PageSwapEvent interface
  • The pageswap event
  • The NavigationActivation interface
  • view-transition at rule
  • <link rel="expect">

This PR adds/updates the BCD for all of these.

Related ChromeStatus entries:

  • https://chromestatus.com/feature/5118874666663936
  • https://chromestatus.com/feature/5205586941837312
  • https://chromestatus.com/feature/5113053598711808

Test results and supporting details

Related issues
items.title: Add data for cross-document view transitions features

items.content_html:
The output of the update-browser-releases script is:

@mdn/browser-compat-data@5.5.15 update-browser-releases
node --loader=ts-node/esm --no-warnings=ExperimentalWarning scripts/update-browser-releases/index.ts --all

Updates for Chrome for Desktop

Release note not found for 123.

  • New status for chrome 123: current, previously beta.
  • New status for chrome 124: beta, previously planned.
  • New status for chrome 122: retired, previously current.

Updates for Chrome for Android

Release note not found for 123.

  • New status for chrome_android 123: current, previously beta.
  • New status for chrome_android 124: beta, previously nightly.
  • New release date for chrome_android 124: 2024-04-16, previously 2024-04-10.
  • New status for chrome_android 122: retired, previously current.

Updates for Webview for Android

Release note not found for 123.

  • New status for webview_android 123: current, previously beta.
  • New release detected for webview_android: Version 124 as a beta release.
  • New status for webview_android 122: retired, previously current.
items.title: Update browser releases

items.content_html:
FF125 supports Intl.Segmenter in https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1883914.
This just changes the supported version from preview to 125.

FYI I know that you would have caught this later on anyway @Elchi3 :-)

Related docs can be tracked in mdn/content#32661
items.title: FF125 Intl.Segmenter

items.content_html:
Summary

In this PR, I'm adding the corresponding impl_url fields for Firefox on the Temporal feature. I'm also taking this opportunity to define a temporal web-feature which will be useful to compute the feature's baseline status.

For Firefox, the entire feature was implemented in one bug, and then later tweaked/refined. So it makes sense that impl_url points to just the one bug.

For Safari, the Temporal feature was partly implemented via multiple bugs. I linked the BCD entries to the right implementation bugs, when I could find them, and then defaulted to the main parent bug when I couldn't find a more specific bug for a particular BCD entry.
items.title: Define a temporal web-feature and add `impl_url` fields for Firefox and Safari

items.content_html:
Summary

This PR links the various Web Bluetooth API features to the corresponding tracking bug on the Safari WebKit tracker. That bug was closed as WONTFIX because Apple is not considering implementing the feature. But it's still the best URL we have to link developers to, I think. That bug has many comments from 3rd-party developers asking for the feature in Safari. So I think this is the right place to link to.

This PR also adds the web-features:bluetooth tag to all the Web Bluetooth API BCD entries, so that we can define a new feature over on the web-features repo.
items.title: Safari `impl_url` for the Web Bluetooth API and bluetooth web-features tag

items.content_html:
This PR updates and corrects version values for Safari (Desktop and iOS/iPadOS) for the normal member of the initial-letter CSS property. The data comes from manual testing, running test code through BrowserStack, SauceLabs and custom VMs.

Test Code:


CSS.supports('-webkit-initial-letter', 'normal');
items.title: Update Safari data for css.properties.initial-letter.normal

items.content_html:
Summary

The Long Animation Frame has moved out of the Long Tasks spec/repo to it's own one:
w3c/longtasks#132 (comment)

Test results and supporting details

N/A simply a spec URL change

Related issues

w3c/longtasks#132 (comment)
items.title: Long Animation Frames API has moved to it's own repo

items.content_html:
Bluetooth.requestDevice() has some new options - including options.filters.manufacturerData and options.exclusionFilters. This adds these options as sub features.

There is also an event that was added in 78. There are other events and features in spec but not clear which are implemented and hard to test.

The version information comes from https://developer.chrome.com/docs/capabilities/bluetooth

I'm adding some docs to go with this here mdn/content#32638
items.title: Bluetooth.requestDevice() options.filters.[manufacturerData/exclusionFilters]
